member.name: T:System.IO.File
member.summary: Class for creating FileStream objects, and some basic file management routines such as Delete, etc.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Copy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies an existing file to a new file. Overwriting a file of the same name is not allowed.
member.param: The file to copy.
The name of the destination file. This cannot be a directory or an existing file.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Copy(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies an existing file to a new file. Overwriting a file of the same name is allowed.
member.param: The file to copy.
The name of the destination file. This cannot be a directory.
true if the destination file can be overwritten; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates or overwrites a file in the specified path.
member.param: The path and name of the file to create.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified file.
member.param: The name of the file to be deleted. Wild-card characters are not supported.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified file exists.
member.param: The file to check.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.Move(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves a specified file to a new location, providing the option to specify a new file name.
member.param: The name of the file to move. Absolute path.
The new path and name for the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.GetAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the FileAttributes of the file on the path.
member.param: The path to the file.
member.returns: The FileAttributes of the file on the path.

member.name: M:System.IO.File.SetAttributes(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes)
member.summary: Sets the specified FileAttributes of the file on the specified path.
member.param: The path to the file.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileAccess
member.summary: Contains constants for specifying the access you want for a file. You can have Read, Write or ReadWrite access.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAccess.Read
member.summary: Specifies read access to the file. Data can be read from the file and the file pointer can be moved. Combine with WRITE for read-write access.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAccess.Write
member.summary: Specifies write access to the file. Data can be written to the file and the file pointer can be moved. Combine with READ for read-write access.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAccess.ReadWrite
member.summary: Specifies read and write access to the file. Data can be written to the file and the file pointer can be moved. Data can also be read from the file.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileAttributes
member.summary: Provides attributes for files and directories.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read-only.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAttributes.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAttributes.System
member.summary: The file is a system file. That is, the file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The file is a directory.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileAttributes.Archive
member.summary: This file is marked to be included in incremental backup operation.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileMode
member.summary:
Contains constants for specifying how the OS should open a file. These will control whether you overwrite a file, open an existing file, or some combination thereof.
To append to a file, use Append (which maps to OpenOrCreate then we seek to the end of the file). To truncate a file or create it if it doesn't exist, use Create.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.CreateNew
member.summary: Creates a new file. An exception is raised if the file already exists.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.Create
member.summary: Creates a new file. If the file already exists, it is overwritten.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.Open
member.summary: Opens an existing file. An exception is raised if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.OpenOrCreate
member.summary: Opens the file if it exists. Otherwise, creates a new file.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.Truncate
member.summary: Opens an existing file. Once opened, the file is truncated so that its size is zero bytes. The calling process must open the file with at least WRITE access. An exception is raised if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileMode.Append
member.summary: Opens the file if it exists and seeks to the end. Otherwise, creates a new file.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileShare
member.summary: Contains constants for controlling file sharing options while opening files. You can specify what access other processes trying to open the same file concurrently can have.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileShare.None
member.summary: No sharing. Any request to open the file (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileShare.Read
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileShare.Write
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:System.IO.FileShare.ReadWrite
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing or reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing or reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileStream
member.summary: Provides a Stream for a file, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous read and write operations.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current stream supports reading.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current stream supports seeking.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current stream supports writing.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of the stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the current position of this stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the file including the file name extension.
member.value: The name of the file including the file name extension.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStream.FilePath
member.summary: Gets the full file-system path of the current file, if the file has a path.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.FileMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileStream class with the specified path and creation mode.
member.param: A relative or absolute path for the file that the current FileStream object will encapsulate.
One of the enumeration values that determines how to open or create the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileStream class with the specified path, creation mode, and read/write permission.
member.param: A relative or absolute path for the file that the current FileStream object will encapsulate.
One of the enumeration values that determines how to open or create the file.

A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that determines how the file can be accessed by the FileStream object. This also determines the values returned by the CanRead and CanWrite properties of the FileStream object.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources associated with the current stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the FileStream and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The byte offset in array at which the read bytes will be placed.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the file and advances the read position one byte.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of this stream to the given value.
member.param: The point relative to origin from which to begin seeking.
Specifies the beginning, the end, or the current position as a reference point for offset, using a value of type SeekOrigin.
member.returns: The new position in the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of this stream to the given value.
member.param: The new length of the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a block of bytes to the file stream.
member.param: The buffer containing data to write to the stream.
The zero-based byte offset in array from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.

member.name: M:System.IO.FileStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the file stream.
member.param: A byte to write to the stream.

member.name: T:System.IO.Path
member.summary: Performs operations on String instances that contain file or directory path information.

member.name: F:System.IO.Path.DirectorySeparatorChar
member.summary: Provides a platform-specific character used to separate directory levels in a path string that reflects a hierarchical file system organization.

member.name: F:System.IO.Path.InvalidPathChars
member.summary: Provides a platform-specific array of characters that cannot be specified in path string arguments passed to members of the Path class.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.ChangeExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the extension of a file path. The path parameter specifies a file path, and the extension parameter specifies a file extension (with a leading period, such as ".exe" or".cool").
The function returns a file path with the same root, directory, and base name parts as path, but with the file extension changed to the specified extension.Ifpath is null, the function returns null. If path does not contain a file extension, the new file extension is appended to the path.Ifextension is null, any existing extension is removed from path.
member.param: The path for which to change file extension.
The new file extension (with a leading period), or null to remove the extension.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetDirectoryName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the directory path of a file path. This method effectively removes the last element of the given file path, i.e.it returns a string consisting of all characters up to but not including the last backslash("\") in the file path. The returned value is null if the file path is null or if the file path denotes a root (such as "\", "C:", or "\\server\share").
member.param: The path of a file or directory.
member.returns: The directory path of the given path, or null if the given path denotes a root.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the root DirectoryInfo or whatever DirectoryInfo markers are specified for the first part of the DirectoryInfo name.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetInvalidPathChars
member.summary: Gets an array containing the characters that are not allowed in path names.
member.returns: An array containing the characters that are not allowed in path names.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the absolute path for the specified path string.
member.param: The file or directory for which to obtain absolute path information.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the extension of the given path. The returned value includes the period(".") character of the extension except when you have a terminal period when you get String.Empty, such as ".exe" or ".cpp". The returned value is null if the given path is null or if the given path does not include an extension.
member.param: The path of a file or directory.
member.returns: The extension of the given path, or null if the given path does not include an extension.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name and extension parts of the given path. The resulting string contains the characters of path that follow the last backslash ("\"), slash ("/"), or colon (":") character in path.The resulting string is the entire path if path contains no backslash after removing trailing slashes, slash, or colon characters.The resulting string is null if path is null.
member.param: The path of a file or directory.
member.returns: The name and extension parts of the given path.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetFileNameWithoutExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the file name of the specified path string without the extension.
member.param: The path of the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.GetPathRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if a path includes a file extension. The result is true if the characters that follow the last directory separator('\\' or '/') or volume separator(':') in the path include a period(".") other than a terminal period.The result is false otherwise.
member.param: The path of a file or directory.
member.returns: The root portion of the given path.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.HasExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if a path includes a file extension. The result is true if the characters that follow the last directory separator('\\' or '/') or volume separator(':') in the path include a period(".") other than a terminal period.The result is false otherwise.
member.param: The path to test.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the path includes a file extension.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.IsPathRooted(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the given path contains a root. A path is considered rooted if it starts with a backslash("\") or a drive letter and a colon (":").
member.param: The path to test.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the path is rooted.

member.name: M:System.IO.Path.Combine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines two strings into a path.
member.param: The first path to combine.
The second path to combine.
